primair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: God reaches out to the ungodly and the irreligious through the event of the Trinity to reconcile and cleanse the world.

subject.identificatie: God (specifically the Triune God in Christ)
tekstueel_bewijs: I am saved by God — the God who in Christ is reaching out
God himself in the person of his Son as he died on the cross
He has gone before us with the Great Commission

object.identificatie: Reconciliation, cleansing from 'dirt', and inclusion in a new community.
tekstueel_bewijs: reconcile the whole world to God
bringing into being an actual new community

zender.identificatie: The Triune God (The Father/The Trinity as the source of love)
tekstueel_bewijs: True relationships originate in God himself

ontvanger.identificatie: The ungodly, the irreligious, the 'unwashed', and all nations.

helper.identificatie: The Holy Spirit and the Church (as witnesses)
tekstueel_bewijs: the Holy Spirit was teaching me
messengers may at any time be preachers
the dirt of China, Liberia, Nepal, Bosnia
tegenstander.toelichting_ernst: The opponent is not just bad habits but the universal human condition of 'dirt' and the systemic 'fragmentation' that only a divine event can resolve.

secundair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The Church (saved people) sharing the good news with the world.
secundair_narratief_programma.subject: The Church / The Hearer
secundair_narratief_programma.toelichting_verhouding: The secondary program (evangelism) is a necessary overflow of the primary program (salvation). One cannot happen without the other, but God's action precedes the Church's.

voorbeelden_god_subject: God in Christ is reaching out
voorbeelden_mens_subject: I am not saved by my spirituality
We desperately need to be brought together
Christians... have been ready to risk everything

voorbeelden: withholding this good news would be a betrayal
good news demands to be told
the Holy Spirit was teaching me
All power is given unto me
In God there is enough strength to overthrow

modale_analyse.modale_interpretatie: The sermon emphasizes God's power (Pouvoir) to save and the inherent 'wanting' (Vouloir) of the news itself, rather than the hearer's duty (Devoir).

semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.theologische_resolutie: The tension is resolved by Christ assuming the 'Dirt' (S2) to create the 'New Community' (S1).
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.ernst_van_s2: High; 'Dirt' is described as the universal 'lowest common denominator'.

diagnostische_evaluatie.classificatie_toelichting: The sermon consistently places God as the active subject of salvation and defines the human condition as one of total inability ('ungodly', 'unwashed').

indicatoren_moralisme.tekstueel_bewijs: Five missionaries... have put their comfort and security on the line

indicatoren_genade.indicator: Rejection of human agency in salvation
indicatoren_genade.tekstueel_bewijs: I am not saved by my spirituality... I am saved by God

indicatoren_genade.indicator: God as the Subject of the Cross
indicatoren_genade.tekstueel_bewijs: All the dirt was assumed by God himself in the person of his Son

exemplarisme_check.beschrijving: Missionaries and 'William' are used, but William is an 'anti-example' (unwashed, mentally ill) who is a messenger despite himself.
exemplarisme_check.alternatieve_lezing: The sermon already treats them as recipients of grace rather than models of virtue.

identificatie_patroon.effect_op_hoorder: Relief and inclusion; the pressure to be 'religious' is removed.
identificatie_patroon.theologische_implicatie: Monergistic salvation; God does the work, man receives and then witnesses.

narratieve_coherentie.coherentie_beschrijving: The narrative flows perfectly from God's nature (Trinity) to God's action (Cross) to the Church's identity (Witness).
spanning_punten: The tension between 'Religion' and 'Evangel' is the central pivot.

soteriologie.tekstueel_bewijs: took our dirt upon himself and bore it away

hamartologie.ernst_diagnose: Critical; described as 'dirt' that makes us 'unlovely' and 'unrighteous'.

aanbevelingen.actantiele_audit_samenvatting: The sermon is a masterclass in theocentric narrative. God is the Subject, the 'Ungodly' are the Receivers, and 'Religion' is the Opponent.

modale_balans.voorgestelde_balans: Maintain as is; this is the 'Grammar of Grace'.

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: This sermon perfectly exemplifies the 'Rutledge Rule'. It avoids moralism by making the 'Good News' an objective event of the Triune God rather than a subjective human achievement.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retorische_analyse: While a rhetorical analysis would focus on the 'Pogo' anecdote, Greimas shows that the anecdote functions to define the Opponent (Dirt) and the Subject's solution.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_exegese: Moves beyond the meaning of 'nations' to the actantial role of 'all nations' as the universal Receiver of a divine mandate.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_greimas: Reveals that 'Religion' is the primary Opponent blocking the Subject (God) from the Receiver (The Ungodly).

appendices.notities: The use of 'Dirt' as a semiotic marker for the human condition is highly effective in deconstructing the 'Religious/Irreligious' binary.
